intro: Pyrenaria microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved pyrenaria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescences that produce small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along rocky outcrops. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
